Major-General 'Daniel Charles Spry', CBE, DSO, CD, was the Canadian commander of
the 3rd Canadian Infantry Division during Operation Veritable in World War II.
He was born in Winnipeg, Manitoba, on February 4, 1913 and died in 1989. {{cite web
 | last = first = authorlink = coauthors = title = Major-General D.C. Spry work
 | = Canada in WWII publisher = date = url = http://www.junobeach.org/e/3/can-pep-can-spry-
 | e.htm doi = accessdate = June 1, 2009 }}
categories: Canadian military personnel of World War II
